Bacteria in packaged water in Kolkata\u2.description: KOLKATA: Drinking water sold in 20-litre jars, at prices half that of reputable brands, are under the scanner following the confirmed presence of coliform bacteria in a large number of samples collected from the southern fringes of the city. KMC is already planning a crackdown on unscrupulous units. More than 100 residents of Vidyasagar Colony, Baghajatin and Ramgarh tested positive for Hepatitis A — which spreads from infected food or water — in less than a fortnight, as reported by TOI on May 31. Times ViewNow that the KMC has evidence, it should act against all unscrupulous bottlers who may be putting the citizen’s health at risk. The action needs to be in the form of a sustained campaign.Now, the test results from the KMC laboratory, confirming the presence of the bacteria, have triggered alarm bells far beyond these areas. With packaged drinking water being widely distributed and consumed across the city, there are fears of more cases emerging from other areas. Physician Sanjay Dasgupta, who is treating more than 50 Hepatitis A patients from these localities, said several packaged water brands had cropped up locally, which sell contaminated water. “I am convinced that packaged drinking water has been a major source of contamination,” he said. “Apart from poor quality of production, most city-based manufacturers and traders also ignore the hygiene factor, which leads to health hazards and may cause stomach-related diseases like colitis and jaundice,” said physician Sanjay Dasgupta. Coliform bacteria are organisms that are present in the environment and in the faeces of all warm-blooded animals and humans. These bacteria will not likely cause illness, but their presence in drinking water indicates the presence of disease-causing organisms (pathogens) in the water system. Most pathogens that can contaminate water supplies come from the faeces of humans or animals. Since testing drinking water for all possible pathogens is complex, time-consuming and expensive, a relatively easy and less expensive test is done for coliform bacteria to rule whether the water is safe to drink. Deputy mayor Atin Ghosh, who also looks after KMC’s health department, has directly blamed units selling spurious packaged drinking water for the spread of enteric diseases in Kolkata and called for a crackdown, with help from the enforcement department. “We need to get rid of unscrupulous traders dealing in packaged drinking water. Going by laboratory tests, we have reasons to worry about the samples of packaged drinking water collected from the affected areas,” Ghosh said. Last year, too, during an outbreak in the Jadavpur-Baghajatin belt that claimed two lives and sent hundreds to hospital, fingers had been pointed at suspect packaged drinking water units. Whereas contamination in civic taps or pipelines is easier to detect and control, the spread of illness can become much wider if the contamination source is spurious packed water, as it is distributed in PET bottles and jars. Last May, following the outbreak, KMC’s water department had collected 20-litre packaged water jars from several vendors and dealers in the affected localities. There is another reason for concern. Debasish Mukherjee, the RSP councillor in the affected belt, said: “Unlike water supplied by KMC, which is filtered or boiled before consumption in various households, contaminated packaged drinking water is dangerous because people presume it is safe and consume it directly.” A KMC laboratory analysis of water samples from several packaged water bottles and jars, as well as civic taps in the affected belt, found presence of coliform bacteria in large numbers. This is the second time that water from these localities has been found contaminated. In the days following the initial reports of the Hepatitis A outbreak, around 14 water samples were collected, of which 12 were found to contain coliform bacteria. Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. \u2018Drunk\u2019 woman loses way, cops.description: KOLKATA: Cops faced an unusual situation on Wednesday morning, when a woman, apparently drunk, created trouble in the Keoratala area under the Haridevpur police station. They finally managed to find the mobile number of her family members and handed her to her mother. The incident took place around 6.30am, when the residents of the locality found a woman in her late 20s loitering aimlessly on the road. “She was rattling the gates of different houses and speaking in a different way. We couldn’t do anything because she is a woman and more importantly, seemed drunk. So, we alerted the police,” said a resident, who was out on morning walk, when he witnessed the scene. After an hour, a woman constable and a civic volunteer reached the spot and took the woman to the police station. “We found out she worked for a catering service and had attended a ceremony on Tuesday. On getting drunk, she lost her way home. But we called her family and her mother took her away,” an officer said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

JU to start domicile reservation this ye.description: KOLKATA: Jadavpur University has got a nod from both the West Bengal Joint Entrance Examination (WBJEE) Board and state government to introduce 90% reservation for domicile candidates while the remaining seats will be offered to other students. On Thursday, the WBJEE Board chairman Malayendu Saha said the domicile reservation will be implemented from this year. However, the decision of the varsity has garnered a divided opinion from various engineering departments. Two engineering departments had, initially, turned down the proposal, citing that the tradition, followed over the past several decades in the varsity, produced excellent alumni. “The department has pointed out it was due to the diversity among students that the department has been able to keep its flag flying high over the years. So, they are not interested in limiting the majority of the seats to domicile candidates only,” said sources. JU, a state-run university, has decided to introduce the domicile reservation system as it accepts several funds from the state government along with other facilities. So, they are willing to reserve maximum seats for the students of Bengal. Many departments pointed out that several other premier state-run technology institutes outside Bengal have also introduced similar reservations for domicile candidates. There are approximately 1,200 seats in the JU’s engineering faculty out of which 45% is for reserved candidates (SC, ST, OBC, PH and others). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kolkata debates Muslim citizens\u2019 le.description: KOLKATA: The letter to CM Mamata Banerjee from a section of Muslims on Wednesday urging two things — strict action against members of the community who indulge in crime to help overcome the perception that they are being shielded or appeased and engage or encourage engagements with Muslim youths and their families across Kolkata in gender-sensitisation, civic consciousness and law-compliance — has triggered a debate with some lauding the initiative and others questioning it. Shahenshah Mirza, the great-great grandson of Wajid Ali Shah, the last nawab of Awadh who settled in Kolkata in 1856, says the letter had gone down well with most of the people he knew. “There is an overwhelming feeling that whenever crime happens, demonstrative action should be taken irrespective of faith and political affiliation. There has been a growing perception in recent years that politicians in Bengal are trying to appease Muslims for their votes. That is not true. I believe it is propaganda. We don’t want anyone to appease the community. All we want is a level-playing field. But because of this perception, many from other communities are turning anti-Muslim. Hence, we have decided to speak out when any such incident happens so that we make our stand clear,” he said. Communications professional Mudar Patherya, who had drafted the letter, said the response from the Muslim community had been largely encouraging. But social activist Shafkat Alam, who was also among the signatories, felt the letter could perhaps have been worded differently to avoid misinterpretation. Alam’s friend Shahab Kalim offered a compelling argument that he was unable to dismiss. “No, I am not embarrassed because the accused (attack on doctors at NRS and cabby driving a model) are Muslims. I am appalled because my religion is being made to stand in the court of criminals. Why are these incidents being highlighted by the religion of the accused? It’s great if the attention of the CM is drawn towards the issue of lack of education amongst Muslim youths, especially ghetto areas. But bouncing the real issue on the springboard of stray incidents is pretentious. Those guys do not represent Muslim youth; they only represent the lawlessness of society,” wrote Kalim, pointing out that Kawariyas who harass many during their yatras are not viewed a religious problem but an administrative issue. His voice found resonance in Anuradha Kapur, founder of women’s empowerment group Swayam. “I feel it is so unfair that they have to come up with a letter like this. When a Hindu commits a crime, we say a person has committed it. Then why should it be different when the person is Muslim? If one looks at the number of women who are raped or sexually harassed, I think the number of Hindu perpetrators will be representative of the Hindu population and likewise for Muslims” she pointed out. Samantak Das, professor of Comparative Literature at Jadavpur University, felt likewise. While everyone ought to feel ashamed of being a part of the system or culture that breeds goons, the entire Muslims is tarnished when a criminal turns out to be Muslim. “When one belongs to a beleaguered minority that is singled out for abuse and widely perceived as essentially violent, perhaps one is left with no other option but to apologise for the actions of those with whom one has no other affiliation than religion.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u2018Clash victims lay on road writhing.description: BHATPARA: Seventeen-year-old Rambabu Shaw, the sole breadwinner of his family of four, was desperate to resume his business of selling phuchkas. The moment the local market reopened on Thursday after a four-day shutdown, he had rushed there to buy ingredients. Around 11.15am, he was returning home with his purchase, when he got caught in a battle of bombs and bullets between a group and cops and was reportedly shot dead. Yards away, another phuchka-seller from the area, Dharamveer Shaw (39), was killed as another stray bullet pierced his belly. Residents of Bhatpara said Rambabu still clutched onto his bags as his lifeless body lay on the road, barely three blocks from his one-room home, where his widowed mother and two younger brothers waited for him. “Rambabu was way more responsible than any boy of his age. After his father died 10 years ago, he quit studying to start earning. He had not gone out to sell phuchkas the last three days because of the violence. The market had reopened only on Thursday in cop presence. But he was hit by a bullet when he was walking back home,” said Ajit Kumar Shaw, a nextdoor neighbour at Kachhari Bazar in Bhatpara. Witnesses told Ajit that Rambabu had tried to dodge the bullets and bomb splinters but one from behind caught him in the head. “He collapsed in front of a shop but the owner downed the shutter. None came to his rescue. Had he been taken to hospital immediately, he could have been saved,” Ajit said.  No help came for Dharamveer either. Even as he lay on the road, writhing in pain and pleading for assistance, people ran past him, scurrying for cover, witnesses said. “With bullets flying and bombs exploding, residents shut their doors and shop owners downed the shutters. None dared to go near the victims,” said a resident. It was at least 20 minutes later that some from the locality, along with cops, took Rambabu and Dharamveer to the Bhatpara state general hospital, where Rambabu was declared dead. Dharamveer died at another hospital. He is survived by his wife and two teen children. Later, when TOI visited the victims’ homes at Kachhari Bazar, an eerie silence had descended on the area. Cops patrolled the streets. “The scene has become almost regular since the assembly bypoll last month. Such has been the state of terror that I have kept my shop closed for more than 20 days since May 19. After today’s incident, no one is going to open their shops for another three to four days,” said Rajesh Shaw, a stationery shop owner. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kolkata likely to remain cloudy today, m.description: KOLKATA: A thunderstorm struck Kolkata for the second consecutive day on Wednesday, leading to a spell of heavy shower. It was triggered by a low pressure and a cyclonic circulation and could be followed by more rain on Thursday. Monsoon could hit south Bengal on Friday, said the Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC). Kolkata recorded a maximum temperature of 37.6°C on Wednesday. Wednesday’s thunderstorm was accompanied by gusty winds that reached a maximum speed of 48kmph. But it didn’t last a minute to qualify as a squall. The day temperature is set to drop on Thursday and the city could remain cloudy. “Low pressure over north Bay of Bengal and a cyclonic circulation that has formed near Jharkhand have started generating clouds. These could float into Kolkata and lead to moderate rain on Thursday. More showers are expected as the low pressure intensifies and we expect monsoon to set in by Friday,” said RMC director GK Das. On Wednesday, several south Bengal districts, including Midnapore, Jhargram, Hooghly and Burdwan, received heavy showers. Weathermen said the rain could gradually intensify across the rest of south Bengal over the next two-three days. “Since the relevant currents have started reviving, we expect the showers to pave the way for monsoon,” Das added. Cyclone Vayu that hit the Gujarat coast earlier this month had stalled the monsoon currents. The Bay branch of the monsoon, which hits south Bengal by the second week of June, was affected. Instead of June 1, which was the scheduled date for its arrival in Kerala, monsoon reached the southern Bengal on June 8. The monsoon arms, including the Bay branch, remained inactive till Vayu passed by. The delay in the onset of monsoon left south Bengal hot and humid. While the maximum temperature in coastal districts remained two-three degrees above normal, a heat-wave warning was sounded for Purulia, Bankura, Birbhum, West Midnapore and Jhargram. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nFolk Music at City Cafeteria in Kolkat.description: Music lovers of the city enjoyed a good dose of folk music at a city cafeteria.  Foot-tapping numbers by Folk Foundation got the crowd grooving. The band comprising Dipannita Acharya, Ludo, Rajkumar, Samrat Mukherjee and Tirthankar Majumdar belted out some amazing Gujarati and Rajasthani songs. Lead vocalist Dipannita also crooned Bangladeshi folk songs, known as Chitogowian, along with Kabir bhajan, songs of Lallan Sai and Radha. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Strike over, prisoners line up for tests.description: KOLKATA: Now that the doctors’ agitation is over, police have started taking undertrials, convicts and arrested people to hospitals for medical examinations, a process that had been put on hold, consequently delaying the process of slapping charges and carrying out investigations. “We had a tough time as we could not get tests done. For some critical cases, we took them to private hospitals but not all could be taken there as charges are high,” said an officer from the Dum Dum police station, who accompanied other officers on a bus, ferrying undertrials to R G Kar Hospital. Several cops had to escort as visits to multiple OPDs were required. “Ten personnel came as we had to take the undertials to the psychiatry, nephrology, gynae, and orthopaedic OPDs. One constable was with each prisoner,” said a sub-inspector. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. I plan to take a core group from Tollywo.description: There was a time when actress Locket Chatterjee — after changing political camps — was called ‘palti didi’ by some of her “good friends” from Tollywood. By her own admission, few among those who had taken a dig at her once are “happy” that she is now a member of Parliament. Others are requesting her to address the problems that are plaguing the Bengali film industry. Days after she attended Parliament, Locket spoke to CT about her plans for organising a meeting of Tollywood artistes with the prime minister and what she expects from fellow Parliamentarians Nusrat Jahan and Mimi Chakraborty. Excerpts: How was your first day at Parliament?It was a good experience. All this while, I used to tune in to the television to watch the proceeding inside Parliament. To walk down those hallowed corridors is a great feeling. More so, because I contested the elections as a leader from the opposition and won. Did you meet other Parliamentarians from the entertainment industry?Nusrat and Mimi weren’t there. I saw Satabdidi (Satabdi Roy). Dev was there too. Dev’s current identity is that of a politician as well as an entertainer. Though you come from the world of movies and serials, you have long distanced yourself from acting and are extremely active at most political events…I had noticed that entertainers were not considered to be hardcore politicians in Bengal. I had always wanted to break that image. I have not joined politics to make a guest appearance. I have worked very hard for it and I don’t wish to be taken lightly. I came to Delhi on Saturday. On Sunday, we had a meeting of a Parliamentary executive committee. This is a very serious body and they must have seen something in me before choosing me to be the whip in charge of the party’s women members. I have been made one of the three whips to handle women BJP MPs. A total of 18 whips were appointed to work under the BJP’s chief whip. The whips are expected to assist the chief whip in ensuring the presence of MPs in the House when important bills are taken up. The Parliament session begins at 11 am. Before that, we have a meeting at 10 am. There were people from the industry who had once called you ‘palti didi’ when you changed sides. Has their attitude towards you changed now?I won’t take names. Many are calling me up now. Some of them who are present at meetings of the ruling dispensation have called me up privately and said they are very proud of me. They have messaged me saying: “Egiye jaa. Songe achhi (Go ahead. We are with you)”. What do you tell them then?I just smile and say: “Bhalo thakis (stay well)”. I don’t know what they will do in future. These were my old friends from the industry. In between, for some reason, they didn’t keep in touch. Now, they are back. My roots lie in Tollywood. Those returning to re-establish ties with me are always welcome. Some had gravitated to a certain side because they felt doing that would ensure jobs for them. But they got used in the process without getting the jobs that they had fancied. Babul Supriyo has acted in more movies after he became a member of Parliament than what he did when he hadn’t joined politics. Haven’t acting offers increased for you now?(Laughs) Since 2016, I was not allowed to do any films. Now, I don’t have the time for movies. The industry often recognises the skillsets of artistes once they are in positions of power. Is there any new-found respect for your acting skill?Yes, people are talking about my acting skills. Since the past six months, people are sending their scripts across to me. I am now being approached for committees formed regarding acting. Are you amused by this shift?(Laughs) Nothing really affects me now. Those who ignored me till yesterday now want to exchange pleasantries with me. Amar songe emon tui-tukari korchhe jeno roj anekhon adda martam amra (They talk to me in a way that makes me feel that we have long adda sessions regularly). They send me scripts, insisting that my presence will help the projects. I have seen the world enough to not get perturbed by all this. There are talks of you spearheading a movement in Tollywood that will challenge the functioning style here…Many, including veteran artistes, are calling me up. But let me make it very clear. Here, I talk as an artiste and not a politician. I know the problems that exist in the film industry. As an artiste, I can fight for the rights of my fellow members from the industry. Payments for overtime are not cleared. Earlier sets were built for shooting. Now, artistes are taken to real locations and asked to shoot without providing the required infrastructure to the unit. The working conditions are terrible.How do you propose to change all this?There has to be an end to this. There is the nagging problem of making unreasonable demands to outstation crews if they want to shoot in Bengal. Many of them are so fed up with this “tolabaji” that they just come, see the locations, say “thank you so much” and then shoot in Mumbai. They are forced to take technicians who are ill-quipped to handle the equipment. This can’t just go on. I have worked with small units too where films were made with passion and on shoestring budgets. We all pitched in and took less remuneration because we wanted the films to be made. However, things got derailed. Despite the best efforts, these projects couldn’t happen because of the enormous demands of the guilds. Nobody could protest. Veteran hair dressers don’t get their due while newbies with no skillset are given monetary rewards. Producers — who used to once do a lot of big serials — simply vanished because they got no slot to showcase their programmes. Bengali film productions abroad had to fold up. Shootings have got cancelled. This involves the future of so many people. How can the industry grow if all such things are allowed? Are you trying to form an alternative guild/forum?I want to fight for those who have been exploited. They are the ones who will lead the movement in Tollywood. I will be there beside them to create this alternative space. Bollywood stars had gone to meet the Prime Minister. Do you have any such plans for Tollywood?Of course, I do. I would want to organise a meeting with a core group from Tollywood and our prime minister. I want to brief him on the current situation in Tollywood. Many technicians and artistes have expectations from me. I have to meet those expectations. Can we expect to see a selfie of Tollywood artistes with the prime minister?Yes. But it’s not about selfies. I want the meeting to help the industry. There is already talks about two groups by BJP leaders — one by director Shankudeb Panda and another by designer Agnimitra Paul — forming two separate units in Tollywood. This has become a butt of ridicule and confusion. What’s your take on that?These are just means to divert the attention away from the actual problems plaguing Tollywood. Why create rifts when we are only trying to improve the condition of the industry? I want to find out a means by which elderly technicians can be given pension. They have given years to the industry but there is no one to look after them once they are past their prime. Why should I be distracted by talks about rifts when I am only concerned about standing beside those who are in need and/or have been exploited in this industry for years? When it comes to the film industry and politics, entertainers are often up for a lot of challenges. Mimi and Nusrat were trolled heavily when they contested and even on their attire at the Parliament. What do you have to say to that?I don’t support the way Mimi and Nusrat were trolled. No one should face this. Nusrat’s marriage is in the news. Do you have any message for her?I wish her the very best for her new journey ahead. While marriage is a big event in one’s life, she must not ignore the promises she made while contesting the elections in Basirhat. From cutting hay with village belles to riding autos, entertainers across party lines have often engaged in various gimmicks while asking for votes. Once they win the polls, they disappear from the constituency. Does that impact the image of entertainers-turned-politicians? Is that why star politicians are often not taken seriously?All I can say is that it isn’t fair to fool your voters. A leader can’t ask for votes, claim to be just a phone call away and then vanish in the time of need. Being an MP is a big responsibility. The poor expect certain things from their elected leader. Guest appearances by star politicians are a huge let down. If you can say you are the ‘ghorer meye’ before the polls, you have to be around when the ‘ghor’ is burning. You can’t give alibis for personal events and shy away from your responsibilities. Nusrat should visit Sandeshkhali and spend time there. How frequently will Hooghly get to see you?I am returning on Saturday and will be going there on Sunday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Medics to face civic heat if they flout.description: KOLKATA: The health department will take strong action against nurses or doctors in any healthcare institution if they are found guilty of not following the dengue treatment protocol. A meeting was held on Wednesday, where KMC officials, along with superintendents and medical superintendent vice-principals of all government hospitals of the city, were present. KMC deputy mayor Atin Ghosh said the health department had come up with a dengue treatment protocol in 2017. An inspection team has been formed by the health department that will visit hospitals where dengue patients are admitted. “If any negligence is found against any nurse or doctor for not properly following the protocol, the health department will take action against them,” Ghosh said. “More monitoring is needed for private hospitals and nursing homes as dengue treatment protocol is often not properly followed. A dengue patient may turn in such case,” he added. Ghosh also said the civic authorities have decided to conduct IGG tests on suspected dengue patients who have suffered from the disease earlier. “At times, the condition of repeat dengue patients turn critical. Repeat patients will be treated as critical,” he said, adding that they would be referred to state hospitals by KMC authorities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

After nine days in ICU, NRS doctor disch.description: KOLKATA: Yash Tekwani, the intern at NRS Medical College and Hospital, who, along with fellow intern Paribaha Mukhopadhyay, was injured during the mob attack on the night on June 10 following the death of an elderly patient, was discharged from hospital on Wednesday. Back from the ICU at NRS after nine days, the young doctor is eager to resume work but doctors have advised him rest. “I have been told that the chief minister has assured the doctors of certain measures to prevent mob attacks. I understand that the situation cannot improve overnight. But I trust that things will start changing for better from now on,” the young doctor told TOI. Hit by a brick on the head, Tekwani, who was on duty at the emergency ward, was treated at the ICU of NRS Medical College and Hospital. His received six stitches and the scalp also developed oedema, which luckily did not percolate to the brain tissues. “The assault left me disoriented the first two days. I had no idea about the protest. My friends told me about it only on the fourth or fifth day, after I was in a more stable condition,” Tekwani said. The resident of Raipur in Chhatisgarh had ranked high in NEET-UG and could secure an MBBS seat at several medical colleges across the country. But he chose Kolkata “because of the quality education offered here”. “I learnt Bangla within a year of my MBBS at NRS so that it would help me interact with patients. I was happy with the quality education offered here. I was excited and eager about my internship till that incident took place,” Tekwani said. He wants to take up either psychiatry or general surgery in his post-graduation. Both Yash and Mukhopadhyay, who started their internship in March, are now fighting the mental trauma that the attack has caused. Tekwani pointed out that the mob attacked them but all they had made every effort to save the patient. They had even administered life-saving drugs, he claimed. “It was a mob of around 200 with sticks and bricks, assaulting us in front of the police. How could those truckload of people be allowed inside the hospital in the first place? I will never forget that incident. But I will not let it scare me away from work,” he said. Thanking those who supported the movement by junior doctors, Tekwani said, “This was required so that such incidents can be prevented in future. Thanks to my friends and teachers for looking after me well.” Tekwani has not let his parents visit him in Kolkata as he feared the protest might worry them even more. Now that he has been discharged from hospital, he will go home to recuperate, as advised by doctors. But before leaving, he plans to visit Mukhopadhyay and try to talk him him of his trauma. “Internship is a crucial part of my training. We are doctors and we cannot afford to keep ourselves away from patients. I would have loved to join duty immediately, had the doctors not advised complete rest. I will return soon with renewed energy,” Yash said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kolkata man arrested for raping minor at.description: KOLKATA: A youth was arrested on charges of raping a minor at Fort William, the headquarters of the Army’s Eastern Command. According to the Army, the accused, Sagar Mallick, was visiting his relative Raja Mallick, a steward at the Army Officers’ Institute (AOI) inside Fort William, who stays at his quarters in the Old Bengal Area Provost Unit (BAPU) Lane on the premises. Preliminary investigation has revealed that Mallick allegedly raped the 11-year-old between 6pm and 8pm on Saturday when her parents had gone to the market. The girl’s father is a neighbour of Raja Mallick and also works at AOI. Her mother also told the police that Mallick is a distant relative and could enter their house easily even when the parents were away. The child apparently broke down after her mother returned and told her everything. An FIR was then lodged against Mallick at the Maidan police station. He has been charged under Section 376 (2)(f) of the IPC and Section 6 of the Protection of Children Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. According to the Army, the police went to Fort William to look for Mallick on Sunday, but could not trace him. He was later arrested from south Kolkata. “It seems that he is related to the wife of Raja Mallick. On questioning them, we came to know of the location in south Kolkata from where he was finally arrested,” a police officer said. “We want to gather some more evidence and the court has sent the accused to police custody till June 24. We will file the chargesheet as early as possible,” said an investigating officer. We are ensuring the girl receives counselling and a medical board has been constituted to keep a check on her health. Her statement has already been recorded in front of a magistrate,” added the investigating officer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shops, markets shut; violence has brough.description: BHATPARA: With the political violence that exploded in Bhatpara during the assembly bypolls refusing to end even after a month, life of people has been the worst casualty. Kachhari Bazar, which has been the epicentre of Thursday’s violence, now appears to be desolate. It wasn’t so in the morning before the clash started. Closed for several days due to clashes, cops from the Bhatpara police station held a meeting with traders and the market committee on Wednesday night. Police repeatedly urged them to reopen the market to bring back normalcy. Ajit Shaw, who works at Reliance Jute Mill, said, “Life here has been completed disrupted for the past month. The market opens for a day or two and then, it is shut down as clashes break out. After today’s violence, I do not know when it will reopen. We need to go elsewhere to purchase even the basic household articles and food.” Jamir Ahmed, a trader, who stays and works at Number 5 railway siding, said, “The entire month of Ramzan was wasted as we were forced to keep the shops shut on most days. We hoped that after the elections, normalcy would be restored. If we do not open the shops for days together, how do we earn and how will we feed our families? People are terrified to even step out. This has to end.” Santosh Shaw, whose shop is not far from Jamir’s, echoed him: “Even during the strife, I had tried my best to keep my shop open. Though this is a minority belt, I have my shop here for years and when I thought I will have to close it down, the locals assured me they would guard it themselves. However, this recent violence has led to prohibitory orders. I can’t open my shop.” A middle-aged woman, who runs a tea stall near Jagatdal Jute Mill, was scared even to speak. “I opened my shop on Thursday after several weeks. But I had to close it down within a few hours,” she said. “My daughter is a private tutor. She has stopped all her classes after evening.” Kankinara Bazar has been affected badly with the violence and the consequent looting. Once a bustling place, the market could not be opened for nearly a week. “Nowadays, we don’t dare to keep our shops open till 10pm, fearing a clash might break out. Now, we shut by 8pm-8.30pm,” a trader said. The roadside food stalls had slowly started opening in the evening. “But owing to the bombing and firing over the past three days kept our customers away,” said a street food vendor at Kankinara Bazar. A cross section of people TOI spoke to were cautious. “Anything can happen at any time,” said a youth who runs a music school on the other side of the railway tracks, supposedly a more peaceful area. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In four years, Howrah-Delhi by train wou.description: NEW DELHI: In the next four years, you can hope to reach Delhi from Howrah in just 12 hours boarding a superfast train. Similarly, the journey from Mumbai to Delhi could be completed in just 10 hours. The railways has set the target to increase the maximum speed of trains on these routes to 160 kmph to cut down the travel time between the national capital and financial capital by five hours and save five-and-half-hours’ journey time between Delhi and Kolkata. The fastest trains now (Rajdhani) can run at a maximum speed of 130 kmph. This is among the clutch of proposals that the railways has finalised as a part of its 100-day agenda under the second edition of the Narendra Modi government. The railways estimates spending of about Rs 13,500 crore in shoring up the national transporter’s infrastructure over the next four years. According to a circular issued by Railway Board chairman V K Yadav, enhancing track infrastructure on these two busy routes is necessary as they account for nearly 30% of passenger and 20% of total freight traffic on the rail network. Yadav has instructed officials to initiate immediate action to start implementing the plans by August 31 and the ministry has sent the proposals to the PMO. Sources said Yadav on Wednesday shared the details of the targets including the plan to bring in private players to run passenger trains on select routes at a meeting of Group of Secretaries on infrastructure. TOI on Wednesday reported the move by railways to open up the passenger segment for private entities and the plan to launch a mega campaign to pursue people to “give up” the concessions that they can avail while buying tickets. The railways has also proposed to obtain all approvals in the next 100 days to eliminate 2,568 level crossings on Golden Quadrilateral and diagonals with rail over bridges and rail under bridges. It has estimated spending of about Rs 50,000 crore in the next four years for this and the entire funding will come from Centre. This will be level two government intervention to do away with level crossing. Earlier, the government had eliminated “unmanned level crossings” either with ROBs/ RUBs or by deploying people after installing gates. Constructing of ROBs and RUBs will ensure seamless traffic movement across the tracks. Other targets include obtaining Cabinet approval for a digital corridor for railways with provision of 10 MHz spectrum in 700 MHz frequency band for railways which will enable it to increase trains’ carrying capacity due to increase speed potential, improve operation during fogs and improved security. Other proposals include providing Wi-Fi at all 6,485 railway stations, starting a pilot for an advanced signalling system, jump-starting process redevelopment of 50 railway stations and restructuring of the Railway Board. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Shyambazar suicide hits Metro services i.description: KOLKATA: Metro services were disrupted during peak hours on Thursday morning after a 55-year-old assistant sub-inspector of the Kolkata Police’s Special Branch attempted suicide at the Shyambazar station around 9.33am. This is the second such incident in three days which affected Metro services during peak hours. The ASI, Amiya Kumar Mondal, a resident of Belgharia, was immediately sent to R G Kar Hospital but doctors declared him dead on arrival. On Tuesday evening, another middle-aged man had committed suicide at the Rabindra Sadan station and the Metro services had been disrupted for over an hour. “On Thursday morning, Mondal was standing at the north end of the down platform at Shyambazar and jumped when the Kavi Subhas-bound train was about to enter. The motorman applied emergency brakes and the train stopped after four coaches entered the platform. Two of them crossed the spot where Mondal jumped. The rake was immediately evacuated and station staff checked if he was still alive. As there was no movement, the rake was reversed and power to the third rail was switched off. Mondal was lying in the central drain between the two rails. He was injured but still alive when we sent him to the hospital,” Metro Railway CPRO Indrani Banerjee said. Officials worked fast and were able to restore the services at around 10.09am. During the gap truncated services were run between the Central and Kavi Subhash stations. Passengers, however, said that they were severely inconvenienced due to the disruption that upset their schedules for the day. Banerjee said there is a procedure that has to be followed after any suicide attempt and those in charge expedited the process for the convenience of passengers. We keep eyes on commuters, especially those behaving differently on platforms or inside the station premises, but there are times when their actions are not very clear. “We went through the CCTV footage carefully. Even those standing beside Mondal were not aware of his motive. Due to the heavy rush during peak hours, it is not always possible to spot people behaving differently. In 2018-19, the Railway Protection Force prevented 20 suicides,” Banerjee added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" CBI quizzes bizman Panja over paintings.description: Kolkata: Businessman Shibaji Panja was interrogated by CBI on Thursday in connection with paintings purchased by Ponzi firm owners. CBI sent him summons a few days ago to appear at the CGO complex office. According to sources, Panja, who was earlier quizzed by CBI officers over the sale of paintings in 2011, was asked if Angel Group had purchased any. CBI officials also handed him another summons related to the Rose Valley probe. The officials wanted to know whether he was privy to sale of paintings to Rose Valley boss Gautam Kundu. Panja said: “I have always cooperated with the agency in their probe and will continue to do so.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two dead in Bhatpara clash; top cop shif.description: BHATPARA (NORTH 24 PARGANAS): Two persons, including a 17-year-old, died and six were injured as the troubled Bhatpara area witnessed a couple of hours of bombing and firing in pitched battles between Trinamool and BJP supporters on Thursday morning. Police intervened, first with a lathi-charge, then with tear-gas and finally fired in the air to bring the situation under control. The latest round of violence came on the same day state director-general of police Virendra was supposed to inaugurate a new police station in Bhatpara; before the day ended, Barrackpore commissioner Tanmay Raychaudhuri had been removed from his post and replaced by Manoj Verma (who was the Darjeeling inspector-general of police). Four of the six injured on Thursday were critical, officials said. Thursday’s deaths took the body count in Bhatpara to five since May 23, the day Lok Sabha poll results were announced and Trinamool rebel Arjun Singh was declared the winner in a fiercely contested fight for the Barrackpore seat. The state government clamped prohibitory orders after Thursday’s violence and Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee gave cops a 72-hour deadline to restore normalcy. Thursday’s violence started around 10.45am about 100 metres from the police station that was supposed to be inaugurated by Virendra. (He was on his way to Bhatpara for the ceremony but turned back towards Nabanna as news of the violence broke; he later returned to the spot but to probe the violence.) Two bombs fell near the labour office gate of the Reliance Jute Mill as workers queued up for their morning shift. The blasts led to widespread panic but, in a few minutes, a crowd of several hundred gathered at the Bhatpara crossing. They chased away the miscreants, who fled towards Kachhari Bazar, and all was quiet for about 30 minutes. But, around 11.20am, a fresh round of violence — with bombs and gunfire — started at Kachhari Bazar, which had reopened on Thursday morning after two weeks following assurance from cops to shop owners that adequate protection would be provided for their security. Phuchka (pani puri) seller 17-year-old Rambabu Sau, who was returning home from the market, was hit by a stray bullet. Another bullet hit 49-year-old Dharamveer Shaw in the abdomen. Both died almost immediately at the spot. There were contradictory accounts of what led to the two deaths and what happened immediately after that. The victims’ kin alleged cops opened fire and this led to the deaths. A few locals claimed they saw armed miscreants roaming around with pistols; a CCTV grab, showing masked men walking with pistols, corroborated this account. But cops said they opened fire in the air in self-defence. The bombs were thrown from West Ghoshpara Lane, they added. Six policemen were injured. Barrackpore MP Singh squarely blamed police. “Cops have given a free run to Trinamool workers. Seven people have been shot at,” he said. Trinamool Congress leader Madan Mitra countered: “It is sad that Singh has cited police firing for the deaths when officials clearly fired in the air. The BJP is seeped in the politics of violence.” The state government took a grim view of the situation. Virendra, who cut short his morning Bhatpara visit, went straight to Nabanna for a meeting with state chief secretary Malay De and state home secretary Alapan Bandyopadhyay. CM Banerjee gave the administration three days to control the situation. She was also angry with the police firing and questioned why history-sheeters were allowed a free run, officials said. Home secretary Bandyopadhyay later told reporters that Section 144 was clamped in two police station areas. “DGP Virendra and additional director-general of police (South Bengal) Sanjay Singh have been asked to reach the spot. The CM is monitoring the situation,” he said, requesting everyone to desist from inflammatory speech and messages. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

There is no reason for us to feel threat.description: Members from the film industry have joined BJP and are trying to make inroads into Tollywood. Are you seeing them as a threat?There is no reason for us to feel threatened. I feel no need to react or counter. I am not aware of what they are saying. Ours is an all-India-based non-political organisation. We have over 7,000 members in the Federation. That excludes 2,500 to 3,000 artistes. I wouldn’t want to comment on what is being done politically. I have doubts about the credentials of those who are claiming that work isn’t happening in this industry. The problems that had festered in the industry after the 34 years of Left regime have been sorted out because we have all united to fight the malice. If work is happening, there will be problems. We sit across the table and sort out the problems. What about the non-clearance of dues? Fingers are being pointed at not just one producer. Other names have also cropped up…We have started processing the dues. I only know of one producer with whom people have issues. As far as my knowledge goes, all the dues have more or less been cleared. We have no complaints from technicians regarding dues from other producers. Is there a meeting on June 23?Yes, we are holding an extraordinary general body meeting where a number of issues will be discussed. We don’t need to meet to counter anyone. This meeting will be held to ensure better working environment. Producers have also been invited to discuss issues involving payments. Will shooting get stalled that day?Yes, we have requested that. If someone wants to increase the shooting time the day after, we will allow that. Problems regarding payments have also cropped up with suppliers. Are you aware of that?I have heard of that problem. But suppliers have a different guild. So, I can’t really talk about that. There are talks about many of your guild members who are not technically sound. What’s the criterion for getting a guild card?A person has to be technically sound to get a card. We see the qualification and past experience. At least two or three years of experience is required. We prefer if an assistant director is a graduate. Is there a fixed format? A hairdresser might not need to be a graduate to do the job. How do you judge if they are good or not? They can just claim that they are good. Who decides whether or not a person makes the cut?Fields like direction, camera, art direction and editing need proper training from institutes. There is so much of learning required to do good makeup or even hair. Work experience is of huge help. We keep an eye on both these factors while giving a card. If we send a makeup artist to a set where the director wants a certain look, he or she has to deliver. Otherwise, it doesn’t work. We have heard of complaints against many card-holders who are technically challenged and end up being a baggage on sets when it comes to handling high-end cameras etc. Have you ever taken away their cards?We have very few members who are inexperienced or don’t know work. Even if we are to believe that this number is 5%, do you take away their cards? After all, they are a burden for any production unit…They go to assist the main technicians. We need assistants for makeup and hair too. Are you organising technical workshop/training for such members?We plan to do that in November-December. \nMusical Event in Kolkata\n.description: The event turned out to be one starry affair with Babul Supriyo, Prosenjit Chatterjee and Vinod Rathod coming together for a cultural evening, organized by Tochan Ghosh, at a city theatre recently .  The programme also saw the who's who of Tollywood in attendance. Babul set the mood for the evening with songs like Tumi robe nirobe, Sedino akashe chilo koto tara and more.He was joined by Rituparna Sengupta, who also crooned a few lines. Usha Uthup added zing to the show with her hit number Uri uri baba. “It's been a long association with Tochonda.Several artistes in Tollywood have got recognition because of him,“ Usha said.
